channel.title: Comments on: Corona Geek On Air – Episode 17 – Hanging with Alex Souza, Founder of Kwiksher

item.title: By: Jorge Sanchez
item.dc:creator: Jorge Sanchez
item.description: Charles, I read the post, and I actually think it *is* an elegant solution. I've done worse, much worse :) I'd love to get in touch with further details on the book. Alex, Definitely planning to showcase. We submitted the app Wednesday for iOS and am in the process of submitting to Amazon, just adding final touches. I'll tweet you the details
item.content:encoded:
Charles, I read the post, and I actually think it *is* an elegant solution. I’ve done worse, much worse ðŸ™‚ I’d love to get in touch with further details on the book.
Alex,
Definitely planning to showcase. We submitted the app Wednesday for iOS and am in the process of submitting to Amazon, just adding final touches. I’ll tweet you the details

item.title: By: Charles McKeever
item.dc:creator: Charles McKeever
item.description: Thanks Jorge. Definitely send me details about your storybook as well. I'd be interested in hearing your story. Did you see Christopher Ward's recent post on the Touch vs Tap event issue? http://coronageek.com/1162/handling-corona-sdk-tap-events-vs-touch-events/
item.content:encoded: Thanks Jorge. Definitely send me details about your storybook as well. I’d be interested in hearing your story. Did you see Christopher Ward’s recent post on the Touch vs Tap event issue? http://coronageek.com/1162/handling-corona-sdk-tap-events-vs-touch-events/

item.title: By: Alex Souza
item.dc:creator: Alex Souza
item.description: Jorge, let me know about your Kwik made storybook. You should showcase it.
item.content:encoded: Jorge, let me know about your Kwik made storybook. You should showcase it.

item.title: By: Jorge Sanchez
item.dc:creator: Jorge Sanchez
item.description: Great episode. Kwik is indeed a great tool. Used it for my latest interactive book app. Keep 'em coming! Btw, I ran into the "tap" "touch" event listener "feature" as well. My fix was to change tap to touch and check for event.phase == "began", and ignore "ended" in the callback function. Worked a treat.
item.content:encoded: Great episode. Kwik is indeed a great tool. Used it for my latest interactive book app. Keep ’em coming! Btw, I ran into the “tap” “touch” event listener “feature” as well. My fix was to change tap to touch and check for event.phase == “began”, and ignore “ended” in the callback function. Worked a treat.

item.title: By: Toff
item.dc:creator: Toff
item.description: The part about Kwik I enjoyed was that even though the code is done for you, you can still add your own extra code if you want to.
item.content:encoded: The part about Kwik I enjoyed was that even though the code is done for you, you can still add your own extra code if you want to.

item.title: By: Alex Souza
item.dc:creator: Alex Souza
item.description: Gang, thanks for the opportunity. I loved to be in the show!
item.content:encoded: Gang, thanks for the opportunity. I loved to be in the show!

item.title: By: charlesmckeever
item.dc:creator: charlesmckeever
item.description: I'm a big fan of tools that speed up my development time. Kwik sounds like the kind of tool that can make things faster for sure. I might have to add it to my work flow.
item.content:encoded: I’m a big fan of tools that speed up my development time. Kwik sounds like the kind of tool that can make things faster for sure. I might have to add it to my work flow.
